questions.question: What is the primary purpose of semantic HTML?
choices: To make websites look visually appealing
To convey the meaning of content, not just its appearance
To add animations to web pages
questions.answer: To convey the meaning of content, not just its appearance

questions.question: Which HTML5 element is used for the main content of a document?
What does the 'alt' attribute provide for images?
choices: A caption that appears below the image
An alternative text description for users who cannot see the image
A link to a larger version of the image
questions.answer: An alternative text description for users who cannot see the image

questions.question: Which HTML5 input type is specifically designed for email addresses?
What does WCAG stand for?
Which HTML5 element is used for navigation links?
What is the purpose of the 'required' attribute in HTML forms?
choices: To specify that a field must be filled out before the form can be submitted
To set a maximum length for input
To apply custom styling to a form field
questions.answer: To specify that a field must be filled out before the form can be submitted

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the four main principles of WCAG?
What does ARIA stand for in web accessibility?
Which HTML5 element is used for content that is tangentially related to the content around it?
What is the purpose of the 'pattern' attribute in HTML forms?
choices: To apply a visual pattern to the form
To specify a regular expression that the input must match
To create a pattern lock for form submission
To generate a unique pattern for each form submission
questions.answer: To specify a regular expression that the input must match

questions.question: Which HTML5 element is used for self-contained compositions like blog posts or news articles?
What is the primary benefit of using semantic HTML for search engines?
choices: It makes the website load faster
It improves the visual design of the website
It provides context and meaning to the content
It increases the number of pages on the website
questions.answer: It provides context and meaning to the content

questions.question: Which HTML5 input type is used for telephone numbers?
What is the purpose of the <header> element in HTML5?
choices: To define a section of navigation links
To contain introductory content or navigational aids
To specify the main content of the document
To create a header image for the website
questions.answer: To contain introductory content or navigational aids

questions.question: Which attribute is used to associate a label with a form input in HTML?
What is the purpose of the <footer> element in HTML5?
choices: To create a sticky footer that always stays at the bottom of the page
To contain concluding content for its nearest sectioning content or sectioning root ancestor
To add a decorative footer image to the page
To specify the font to be used in the footer text
questions.answer: To contain concluding content for its nearest sectioning content or sectioning root ancestor

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using semantic HTML?
What is the purpose of the 'aria-label' attribute?
choices: To add a visible label to an element
To provide a text alternative for background images
To create a label for form inputs
To provide a text description for elements that don't have visible text
questions.answer: To provide a text description for elements that don't have visible text

questions.question: Which HTML5 element is used to define a standalone section of a document?
What is the purpose of using heading tags (h1-h6) in a logical hierarchy?
choices: To make the text larger and more visually appealing
To improve the website's loading speed
To create a clear document outline for users and assistive technologies
To increase the keyword density for SEO
questions.answer: To create a clear document outline for users and assistive technologies

questions.question: Which HTML5 input type automatically validates that the input is a valid URL?
What is the primary purpose of the 'role' attribute in HTML?
choices: To assign CSS styles to an element
To specify the importance of an element
To define the function of an element for accessibility purposes
To determine the order of elements in the DOM
questions.answer: To define the function of an element for accessibility purposes

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a semantic HTML5 element?
What does the 'autocomplete' attribute do in HTML forms?
choices: Automatically submits the form when all fields are filled
Suggests input based on the user's previous entries
Checks the spelling of user input
Completes the form with random data for testing
questions.answer: Suggests input based on the user's previous entries

questions.question: Which principle of WCAG ensures that user interface components and navigation must be operable?
What is the purpose of the <figure> and <figcaption> elements in HTML5?
choices: To create decorative borders around images
To group media content with its caption
To create slideshows of multiple images
questions.answer: To group media content with its caption

questions.question: Which HTML5 input type is used for selecting a date and time?
What is the purpose of the 'tabindex' attribute in HTML?
choices: To specify the order of elements when navigating with the Tab key
To set the number of spaces for indentation in the code
To create a table of contents for the page
questions.answer: To specify the order of elements when navigating with the Tab key

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using HTML5 form validation attributes?
choices: It eliminates the need for server-side validation
It makes the form visually appealing
It reduces the need for JavaScript validation and provides a more consistent user experience
It automatically encrypts the form data
questions.answer: It reduces the need for JavaScript validation and provides a more consistent user experience
